The idea is that people who attend NFC and don't know anyone can participate and meet other people and maybe make friends.

What happens: The participants will seat themselves at the tables. Each table is a team. Each table will have an answer sheet. I will ask the questions one after another, leaving some time for the people to actually answer. Once the questions are over, a little time to review, then the answer sheets will be turned in, and redistributed to other teams, so every team will have the answer sheet of a different team. Then I'll show the answers, and the teams will have to score the other teams. at the end all the answer sheets will be collected again and a winner will be selected.

There will be three winning teams with different prices:
1st team: Diploma (will be given out during closing ceremony) + Best Chocolate box
2nd team: Better chocolate box
3rd team: Decent chocolate box

Or somewhere passers-by can see and interact, because part of the fun is entertaining others.

Learn the basics of walk-around hand-puppetry with Wah, Lindt and friends. Covers different types of puppet, taking care of your friend, creating and playing a character, props, and more. Bring one from home, or try one of the samples!
column29: I've not run this event before, but I've been doing this kind of puppeteering for over a decade at many conventions, so I have lots of experience on what to do (and what doesn't work so well). I think this is a good way to serve the interest of puppeteering without having a big stage event like ConFuzzled and Eurofurence.
column31: Puppets can make a great photo op. Could be an opportunity to fill space with the history of puppettering in the fandom, such as the Funday PawPet Show, Fluff and Such, musical sing-alongs popular in the USA, and of course the (slightly different) Eurofurence and ConFuzzled stage shows.
